activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Ionetz to 17 years Imprisonment, consisting of 7 years Initial Confinement and 10 years Extended Supervision.

--The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp", after 7 years of Initial Confinement. 

--The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program,  after 7 years of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
--The Court requires Mr. Ionetz to pay the $500 surcharge of each of the 14 counts, totaling $7000.

--repay Jefferson County for costs of Defense, to include expert fees and attorney fees

--payment of all surcharges, costs, and fees

**3/28/19: 
--Defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court Appointed Attorney fees in the amount of $4,381.44.

--Defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for expert fees in the amount of $18,180.65.**

--child sex registration requirement

--any and all treatment and counseling as required by Agent 

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Arresting Agency: Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation

supervisions.notes: --The Court requires Mr. Ionetz to register as a Sex Offender

--The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp", after 7 years of Initial Confinement. 

--The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program,  after 7 years of Initial Confinement.

records.addlTxt: Oral ruling on December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

IT IS ORDERED that the time for the circuit court to decide the defendant's
postconviction motion is extended to December 5, 2022.
Oral ruling on October 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

IT IS ORDERED that the time for the circuit court to decide the defendant's
postconviction motion is extended to October 4, 2022.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within five days of the date of this order, Attorney Teuta Jonuzi shall either opt in to participate in the Court of Appeals electronic filing system for this case or provide this court with an explanation for not doing so.

Copy of MOTION TO EXTEND TIME IN WHICH TRIAL COURT MAY ISSUE A
DECISION ON DEFENDANT-APPELLANT'S MOTION FOR POSTCONVICTION RELIEF filed with the Court of Appeals.
Oral ruling on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:22am 
Defendant Michael W Ionetz appears by videoconferencing from Stanley Correctional Institution, in custody.  Attorney Teuta Jonuzi appears by telephone.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Ionetz that he can see and hear the proceedings through the video connection. 
The Court voices that the Court's hope was to issue an oral decision today, however the Court's calendar has not allowed time for this decision. The Court schedules the oral decision sixty days out. 
recess 10:24am

NEXT:  Oral Ruling on October 3rd at 10:00am-JA please make arrangements for Mr. Ionetz to appear by video, and Defense counsel may appear remotely (by telephone or by Zoom video if the video-format becomes a Zoom-type video appearance by Mr. Ionetz)

The Defense calls attorney Joseph Fischer for testimony.

--Examination by the Court

The Court sets the following briefing schedule:
The Court instructs the Defense to submit their brief no later than 06/06/22, end of business.
The Court instructs the State to submit their response brief no later than 07/11/22, end of business.
The Court instructs the Defense to submit their reply brief no later than 07/25/22, end of business.

recess 9:17AM

[ml] Case called at 2:06PM
Defendant Michael W Ionetz appears via telephone from the Stanley Correctional Facility, in custody with attorney Teuta Jonuzi. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock requests that this matter be set for a Machner hearing, and requests that Court give the State be given 45 days to generate a brief.
The Court instructs the State to submit its brief no later than 02/28, end of business.

The Court requests that the Defense file a writ for the Defendant's appearance at the next scheduled hearing.

recess 2:11PM

NEXT: Motion Hearing on 04/04 at 8:30AM (The Court requires three hours for this hearing)

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 8:28 AM 
Defendant Michael W Ionetz in court, in custody with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that It has reviewed the file in its entirety since the Jury Trial

The Court finds beyond a reasonable doubt that the JOC for Case 10CF166 provides the factual necessary basis for repeater allegations.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Shock
Statement made by S.I-D
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Fischer
Statement made by Mr. Ionetz

On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Ionetz to 17 years Imprisonment, consisting of 7 years Initial Confinement and 10 years Extended Supervision.
On Counts #2: The Court sentences Mr. Ionetz to 7 years Imprisonment, consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to the sentence in Count #1 
On Counts #3--#14: The Court sentences Mr. Ionetz to 10 years Imprisonment, consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement and 7 years Extended Supervision, concurrent to the sentences in Counts #1 and #2

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp", after 7 years of Initial Confinement. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program,  after 7 years of Initial Confinement. 

The Court gives   58  days credit for time already served, to be applied to Count #1 and #3--#14.

The Court requires Mr. Ionetz to register as a Sex Offender
The Court requires Mr. Ionetz to pay the $500 surcharge of each of the 14 counts, totalling $7000.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--repay Jefferson County for costs of Defense, to include expert fees and attorney fees
--child sex registration requirement
--any and all treatment and counseling as required by Agent 
--payment of all surcharges, costs, and fees 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings form given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 9:24am
2010CF166 Judgment of Conviction

Order for payment of Atty. Fischer as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $4005.96 .

cc: Bookkeeping on 1/21/19--ma

[MK] case called at 9:14am 
Defendant Michael W Ionetz in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Final Status/Scheduling Conference today and for Jury Trial later this month.
ADA Shock indicates that the State is prepared to proceed to Jury Trial as scheduled.
Attorney Fischer indicates that the Defense is not prepared to proceed to trial; further time is needed.  Attorney Fischer provides the information that Mr. Ionetz has raised the funds to hire an investigator and the Defense did hire him. The investigator needs more time, and the Defense will be seeking a protective order so that the investigator can get a copy of the hard-drive.  Attorney Fischer explains that the investigator needs release of a copy of the hard drive, rather than going to State Crime Lab to view it, because the investigator uses a different software program.  
After the Court raises to Attorney Fischer that this adjournment-basis information is the same as provided in the August motion, Attorney Fischer indicates that more funds for the payment of the investigator were needed in the interim and those funds have now been provided.  Attorney Fischer indicates that he is fairly confident that Mr. Ionetz will be able to make the payments to resource the expert as additional amounts are needed. 

The Court requires the filing of the Defense protective-order motion by end of business on 12/12/16.
The Court continues the Bond and conditions of Bond.

Defendant Michael W Ionetz in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In response to the Court's inquiry of Attorney Fischer whether the Amended Motion filed by the State changes the Defense position on the Motion, Attorney Fischer indicates that the Defense continues to oppose.
The Court grants the State's Amended Second Motion to Allow Production and Admission of Other Crimes, Wrongs or Other Acts Evidence, citing that the State intends to offer these items on the issues of knowledge, and absence of mistake or accident.  The other images are also relevant to provide context for how the investigation developed.  
After Attorney Fischer requests that State be limited to only raising the 256 images and 17 videos in Rebuttal if a lack of knowledge or mistake is actually raised as a defense, the Court denies the request, finding that the evidence is admissible during the State's case in chief because the State is required to prove knowledge as one of the elements of the offense.
The Court grants the State's additional Motion for Other Acts; this relates to the three videos which were discovered before the search warrant was requested; this Motion is being granted on the basis of context and background.  It's also relative, to a more limited extent, on knowledge
As to these rulings, the Court indicates that it will give a cautionary instruction upon the request of either party. 
The Court schedules trial; counsel agree that a two-day trial length is needed.
The Court indicates to Mr. Ionetz that the deadline for any settlement of the case will be at that Final Status/Scheduling Conference on August 23rd.
The Court continues the Bond and its conditions.
recess 9:33am.
